nodes.text: An IoT based system using Node MCU can provide integrated smart home automation and smart security over Wi-Fi/3G/4G, overcoming range and reliability drawbacks of existing short-range wireless methods
Existing short-range home automation methods (Bluetooth, ZigBee, voice via Bluetooth) and GSM have limitations: limited range, dependence on signal to noise ratio, and unreliable message delivery

Proposed system architecture: sensors and actuators connected to Node MCU; camera connected to Arduino UNO; Node MCU provides Wi-Fi connectivity and can fall back to 3G/4G; user interacts via smartphone app and receives email alerts

System functions combine three modes: smart security (IR-triggered image capture and email alert), smart home automation (remote control of lights and fans via internet), and environment monitoring (DHT11 and MQ135 sensors reporting temperature, humidity, and air quality)
Hardware components used include Node MCU (ESP8266), Arduino UNO, OV7670 camera module, IR sensor, DHT11, MQ135, relay board and smartphone app
These limitations motivated implementation of an IoT system that uses Wi-Fi and cellular fallback to enable long-distance control and more reliable alerts

Camera is connected to Arduino UNO because Node MCU has a single analog input; when IR sensor detects motion Arduino powers camera, stores captured images on PC, and sends the image by email to the owner
Sensors (DHT11, MQ135, IR) are read by Node MCU and values are updated to smartphone every second via the app, enabling environment monitoring and remote actuation
Relays driven by the microcontroller switch AC/DC loads (lights, fans) on owner command from remote smartphone or in response to sensor conditions
Result: When IR detects motion the system captures an image and sends it by email to the predefined owner address; owner can remotely trigger lights/fans or alert authorities
Result: Remote control of lights and fans via internet demonstrated; system can operate over Wi-Fi or via cellular data (3G/4G) when Wi-Fi is unavailable

Result: Environment monitoring data (temperature, humidity, air purity) is displayed on the smartphone app every second and can trigger fan activation if air impurity or temperature exceeds thresholds
Advantages claimed: low cost, supports both security and automation, helpful for handicapped and elderly, long distance control, improved user decision making via camera images

Conclusion: IoT based home automation and security can provide comfort and simplicity and allow users to respond to intrusions or environmental hazards remotely; system could be implemented on other platforms such as Raspberry Pi
Limitation: The overall system functionality depends on availability of internet or cellular data; IoT growth raises additional concerns and considerations
